Posts.EditableText: Hi (again) all Although I've not been around the Quest forums much for a LONG time, just thought I'd tell those who remember me (and/or my libraries for Quest) from the early days of Q1 through to Q3, that I expect to be back and taking an active part in the forums again starting from, well, now really! Why now? Well my original collaborator is now back at work after some considerable time off due to family considerations, and this time wants to write a game for general consumption. This means that we should be able to contribute more than just the incidental code and libraries we've output in the past. We did discuss at length using TADS 3, Inform 7 or Alan instead of Quest, but the (much maligned in some quarters) Quest GUI player which was so important and the deciding factor in using Quest for our earlier efforts has won out, so Quest it will be. All I have to do now is get up to speed with Q4, I suspect my brain is still firmly stuck in Q3 mode Regards Al (MaDbRiT)

Hi (again) all

Although I've not been around the Quest forums much for a LONG time, just thought I'd tell those who remember me (and/or my libraries for Quest) from the early days of Q1 through to Q3, that I expect to be back and taking an active part in the forums again starting from, well, now really!

Why now? Well my original collaborator is now back at work after some considerable time off due to family considerations, and this time wants to write a game for general consumption. This means that we should be able to contribute more than just the incidental code and libraries we've output in the past.

We did discuss at length using TADS 3, Inform 7 or Alan instead of Quest, but the (much maligned in some quarters) Quest GUI player which was so important and the deciding factor in using Quest for our earlier efforts has won out, so Quest it will be.

All I have to do now is get up to speed with Q4, I suspect my brain is still firmly stuck in Q3 mode

Regards

Al (MaDbRiT)
